title: Bug 6322: All types dialog shows obfuscated classes too prominently
description: Bug 6322: The All types dialog in JDK 1.4 includes obfuscated classes (a, a1, b, c, d) etc. These obfuscated classes should be displayed less prominently to avoid confusion.
OB: When opening the All types dialog in JDK 1.4, the obfuscated classes (a, a1, b, c, d) are displayed with the same prominence as regular classes.
EB: The obfuscated classes (a, a1, b, c, d) should be displayed with less prominence than regular classes in the All types dialog.
SR: To reproduce the issue, open the All types dialog in JDK 1.4 and observe the prominence of the obfuscated classes (a, a1, b, c, d) compared to regular classes.
